page.title: 17Mattingley Area - Recreation
page.content: {There are no public recreational {facilities within the block.}The countryside is riddled with footpaths for those who enjoy{walking}& bridle- ways for the many{horse-riders}in the area. Bluehouse Farm offers training facilities for pony & rider & has livery stables. It prides itself on the fact that Diana Clapham, who won a silver medal when she rode in the 1984 Olympics, was trained here. The Rivers Whitewater & Hart plus several small ponds provide for the{anglers}whilst the network of country lanes attract {cyclists. Hazeley Heath is a Site of {Scientific Interest}& consequently attracts bird-watchers, botanists & the like - its sandy tracks are used by budding{motorcyclists & BMX riders. Council{allotments}have recently been opened in West Green Road to cater for the increasing demand.
